title: PSA - If I am mid VS an assassin and I am not an assassin, do not expect me to follow them
body:
Getting really tired of playing against champions like Zed and Fizz, knowing full well that they are heading botlane and using my missing and warning ping to alert them
Then they die to them and they start complaining that you do nothing and should have come down with them

I AM NOT suicidal enough to take someone like Lux or Ahri into the depths of the jungle where i know there is an assassin who is going to wipe me off the map if i encounter them, please listen to the frantic pings and let me get an advantage through getting an extra 2+ waves of creeps so I start overleveling them and dealing turret damage

It is very unlikely all 4 will be warded at the same time. They could also just simply be sitting behind the wall lip in dragon pit and you won't see them till you are walking that way. Multiple bushes (that are even less likely to be warded) if you don't take the river path that they could go to.

I was playing a game as {{champion:35}}  this one time, and we had a {{champion:99}}  mid and they had a {{champion:25}} mid. What happened was that their mid kept on roaming bot and into our jungle because they had a salty {{champion:121}}  jungle that kept on invading. Whenever I went to steal a buff, that same {{champion:25}}  would come along and help out their {{champion:121}} .

Our {{champion:99}}  never roamed, and it put our bot lane and myself in a deep hole because she was too busy doing jack shit while their {{champion:25}} was pretty much carrying the game for them.

If the enemy mid laner is clearly going bot lane, run through the jungle and at least toss a spell or two. Just the mere presence of you under tower can dissuade a tower dive and team fight.
Well following Morg really isnt the same as following Zed/Fizz/LB/Kassadin
Yeah that is more of Lux being stupid, but I mean she should know how shaco works, and how that he invades and kills well
Following a Morgana that's ahead is still devastating. 10 hour stun followed by the pool and the ult and a magic damage shield to deny any reaction the Lux might have had.

However the thing is this:

She might just have been losing lane. There's nothing wrong with that, it happens. What this causes is, especially with a Morgana ahead, she pushes hard and easy with the pool.
Consequence: constantly being pushed makes you unable to roam. Because of this: you roam when being pushed = giving up cs you desperately need to get back, while you might roam and get nothing out of it and thus remain as useless as before the roam + losing tower damage.

I 'once' had a game in botlane. I was either {{champion:222}} or {{champion:81}} (I don't remember), but what I do remember is my friend was playing {{champion:99}} vs {{champion:238}}. At some point {{champion:238}} backed, then {{champion:99}} did the same after another wave. When {{champion:238}} came back he pushed and roamed bot. We warded (probably the support, but anyway) so we saw him coming, we played safe and right as he was about to leave, my friend {{champion:99}} thought it was necessary to help.
IT DIDN'T! {{champion:238}} stayed, {{champion:99}} stayed. I think for about 2 minutes. If she had just taken midlane, Zed would've left and botlane would have been fun again.

Honestly, when I play LeBlanc and I'm ahead, this is basic stuff: Get blue, push lane, fake a roam (make it so they absolutely see the direction you leave lane), sit in bush, wait and assassinate. That's why midgame I always carry a pink on me.

Or to give a example where I played {{champion:238}} , which I almost never do. I roamed bot, they didn't know or react to pings, I got an easy double, and right then the midlaner arrived. I was happy to take the triple. AND I came back in a lane that was still not pushed towards my turret, so I don't remember, but I probably took the tower too.

So, to sum up: roaming just because your opponent roams, imho, a bad idea. You just warn, make him lose cs and hope my botlane reponds to my pings. And sometimes you don't have a choice but to stay in lane.
It MIGHT be good to roam too. But that completely depends on the situation.

You seem to be under the mistaken impression that farm or kills win games. They don't. Pressure does. Taking objs does. This is why assassins roam bot often. Not for kills or to catch up to the enemy lamer. It's done to apply pressure to a portion of the map that contains the most objectives with a tower, a buff, and drake all close. An assassin that applies more pressure than a passive lamer who won't leave his lane at the times he should be is an assassin that's likely to win the game because of the lack of game understanding displayed by his opponent.

I mean I totally understand where you are coming from, and I agree that you probably should follow or at least try and keep eyes on the roaming assassin, but the very basis of your statement was flawed. You didn't provide any adequate advice, all you did was say something that is fundamentally known. Your original statement could be paraphrased as, "You're losing already, so go make sure they don't make somebody else lose. **In order to not lose, don't lose**." You basically just said "git gud" and that was that.

More importantly if they BACK and i PING MISSING ANYWAYS how the hell should i know where they went after that if they never came to lane? Most infuriating situation when a lane yells at you for not following someone you haven't seen for 2mins.

My general rule:
If I'm say Ahri mid against a Zed and I see him roam bot lane, and I ping he's missing and danger bot lane only, maybe even type "zed headed bot", and they don't back off - it's 100% their fault. 

If on the other hand I just notice Zed isn't in lane when he should be but I don't know which way he went? So I ping missing but that's it? My fault. You can't expect everyone else on the map to suddenly stop whatever they're trying to accomplish (e.g. immediately give up any advantage they may have) because you gave your opponent a free lane. 

I don't even care if it's an assassin or what the case is to be honest. I don't care if following was practical and I could safely follow. If I KNOW which way he's going and warn you plenty in advance and **choose to take the guaranteed advantage of turret damage and extra creep xp over an uncertain outcome fight** (what if their jungler is going too, what if they outplay us, etc...) that's MY call. 

Of course, if I choose to make that call, once I have that turret I should probably roam to the same lane later to get them rolling as well. Point is though, it's my choice to follow for a fight or to push advantage in my lane - I could have any reason for not wanting that fight.
